Bridge Construction and Repair.definition: Projects involving the construction, replacement, or repair of bridges.
Bridge Construction and Repair.text_example: A project to replace an existing bridge with a new structure.

Roadway Rehabilitation and Resurfacing.definition: Projects focused on rehabilitating or resurfacing existing roadways, including milling, paving, and overlay work.
Roadway Rehabilitation and Resurfacing.text_example: A project to resurface a section of highway with new asphalt.

Traffic and Safety Improvements.definition: Projects aimed at enhancing traffic flow, safety, and pedestrian accessibility, including signal installations and sidewalk construction.
Traffic and Safety Improvements.text_example: A project to install new traffic signals and improve pedestrian crossings.

Maintenance and Upkeep.definition: Projects related to the routine maintenance and upkeep of existing infrastructure, including mowing, litter removal, and structural repairs.
Maintenance and Upkeep.text_example: A contract for regular mowing and litter removal along highways.

New Construction and Expansion.definition: Projects involving the construction of new infrastructure, such as new roads, interchanges, or roundabouts.
New Construction and Expansion.text_example: A project to build a new roundabout at a busy intersection.

Drainage and Water Management.definition: Projects focused on improving drainage systems, including culvert installations and stormwater management.
Drainage and Water Management.text_example: A project to install new culverts and improve stormwater drainage.

Pedestrian and Bicycle Infrastructure.definition: Projects aimed at enhancing infrastructure for pedestrians and bicyclists, including sidewalk construction, bike lanes, and shared-use paths.
Pedestrian and Bicycle Infrastructure.text_example: A project to build new sidewalks and bike lanes along a busy street.

Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS).definition: Projects related to the implementation and expansion of intelligent transportation systems, including smart traffic management and surveillance.
Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS).text_example: A project to install a new intelligent transportation system along a highway corridor.
